text: Below is a table of all United States presidential elections in Hawaii since it became a state in 1959. Hawaii has historically been a strong "blue" state, voting Democrat in 14 out of 16 of their presidential elections. == Table == Year Winner (nationally) Votes % Loser (nationally) Votes % Electoral votes 1960 John F. Kennedy (D) 92,410 50.03% Richard Nixon (R) 92,295 49.97% 3 1964 Lyndon B. W. Bush (R) 158,625 44.8% Michael Dukakis (D) 192,364 54.3% 4 1992 Bill Clinton (D) 179,310 48.1% George H.W. Bush (R) 136,822 36.7% 4 1996 Bill Clinton (D) 205,012 57.0% Bob Dole (R) 113,943 31.7% 4 2000 George W. Bush (R) 137,845 37.46% Al Gore (D) 205,286 55.79% 4 2004 George W. Bush (R) 194,191 45.26% John Kerry (D) 231,708 54.01% 4 2008 Barack Obama (D) 325,871 71.85% John McCain (R) 120,566 26.58% 4 2012 Barack Obama (D) 306,658 70.55% Mitt Romney (R) 121,015 27.84% 4 2016 Donald Trump (R) 128,847 30.03% Hillary Clinton (D) 266,891 62.22% 4 2020 Joe Biden (D) 366,130 63.73% Donald Trump (R) 196,864 34.27% 4 * Candidates in bold won the state of Hawaii in the election. === Overall party comparison === Year Democrat % Votes Republican % Votes Margin 1960 50.03% 92,410 49.97% 92,295 0.06 1964 78.8% 163,249 21.2% 44,022 57.6 1968 59.8% 141,324 38.7% 91,425 21.1 1972 37.5% 101,409 62.5% 168,865 25.0 1976 50.59% 147,375 48.06% 140,003 2.53 1980 44.8% 135,879 42.9% 130,112 1.9 1984 43.82% 147,154 55.10% 185,050 11.28 1988 54.3% 192,364 44.8% 158,625 9.5 1992 48.1% 179,310 36.7% 136,822 11.4 1996 57.0% 205,012 31.7% 113,943 25.3 2000 55.79% 205,286 37.46% 137,845 18.33 2004 54.01% 231,708 45.26% 194,191 8.75 2008 71.85% 325,871 26.58% 120,566 45.27 2012 70.55% 306,658 27.84% 121,015 42.71 2016 62.22% 266,891 30.03% 128,847 32.19 2020 63.73% 366,130 34.27% 196,864 29.5 == Related pages == * United States presidential election Category:History of Hawaii Category:United States presidential elections
